risks.conflicting_policy_excerpt: 1. Purpose Establish a structured process for reviewing, updating, approving, and versioning all internal policies — ensuring governance, accountability, and continuous alignment with business needs and regulatory requirements.

risks.divergence_summary: The company's offboarding policy generally aims to ensure access control but lacks the specific, time-bound requirement for immediate access revocation upon employee termination mandated by the new regulation.
risks.conflicting_policy_excerpt: Define standard procedures for securely and consistently onboarding new employees/contractors and properly offboarding departing personnel — to ensure data security, access control, resource management, and compliance.
risks.new_rule_excerpt: Immediate revocation upon employee termination (within 2 hours)
risks.recommendation: Immediately revise the 'Onboarding & Offboarding Procedures' policy to explicitly include the requirement for immediate access revocation within 2 hours of employee termination, and ensure operational processes and systems are updated to comply with this strict timeline. Conduct a full review of the policy against all articles of the new regulation to identify and address all other compliance gaps.
